title: Dudley Sirisena hints at bringing latest helicopter to Sri Lanka
byline: No byline

title: England captain Stokes suffers facial injury after being hit by ball
byline: England Test captain Ben Stokes suffered a facial injury after being hit by a ball while coaching Durham’s academy.

title: Sri Lanka urge Pakistan to reconsider India game boycott
byline: Sri Lanka’s cricket board on Thursday asked Pakistan to reconsider its decision to boycott their first-round encounter with arch-rival India in the T20 World Cup co-hosted by the island.

title: Special traffic and security measures in place for ICC T20 World Cup in Colombo
byline: The Colombo Traffic Division has announced a special traffic management plan to be implemented in Colombo during the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament, which will be held from 07 February to 08 March 2026.

title: Trump endorses Japan’s Takaichi ahead of snap election
byline: Donald Trump has endorsed Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of a snap election in her country on Sunday.

title: Mafia behind escalating prices of lands, housing: Deputy Minister
byline: A situation has arisen where prices of lands, houses and housing schemes have begun to escalate sharply, Deputy Minister of Urban Development Eranga Gunasekara said yesterday, calling it a mafia.

title: Supreme Court’s green light for abolition of MPs’ pension
byline: The Supreme Court has held that the proposed MPs Pension Repeal Bill is consistent with the Constitution and can be approved by a simple majority.

title: Sri Lanka still among the worst in the world to protect the environment?
byline: Sri Lanka ranked 134 out of 180 countries in the latest Environmental Protection Index (EPI) report compiled by Yale and Colombia universities with a score of 38.8 out of 100 on their national efforts to protect environmental health.

title: Helicopter rehearses landing at Kandy President’s house premises ahead of AKD’s visit
byline: A special rehearsal was conducted to assess whether Sri Lanka Air Force helicopters could land on the open ground behind the Kandy President’s House.

title: Sri Lanka looks to introduce skydiving for tourism
byline: A meeting to study the feasibility of introducing skydiving activities in Sri Lanka was held at the Ministry of Defence yesterday by Defence Secretary Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) and a group of representatives of Skydive Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. risking reform credibility with vehicle permit carve-outs: Advocata
byline: The Advocata Institute yesterday said that any move by the Government to revive or accommodate vehicle permit concessions for a select group of retired senior public officials would undermine governance credibility, weaken public trust, and dilute Sri Lanka’s economic reform effort.

title: Sri Lanka to demand compensation from UK for damages, theft of assets during colonial period: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka intends asking for compensation from the UK for damages of properties, thefts and loss of lives that had taken place during the colonial period, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath told Parliament today.

title: Businessman challenges constitutionality of Protection of Occupants Bill before SC
byline: A businessman has filed a Special Determination petition before the Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of the proposed Protection of Occupants Bill, 2025.

title: Ambuluwawa cable car to resume if no environmental damage found: Minister
byline: Minister of Environment Dhammika Patabendi engaged in an observation tour of the Ambuluwawa Biodiversity Complex yesterday to assess the current status of the proposed development projects, including the controversial cable car initiative.

title: Anusha Palpita further remanded
byline: Anusha Palpita, former Director General of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over the alleged unlawful acquisition of assets worth nearly Rs. 46 million, was ordered to be further remanded till February 20 by Colombo Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Sri Lanka gears up to face potential Nipah virus threat
byline: Sri Lanka has strengthened its preparedness to detect and respond to a potential outbreak of the deadly Nipah virus (NiV) with health authorities stepping up surveillance and laboratory readiness amid growing regional concerns.

title: No new laws on Beach Seine fishing
byline: The Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources has clarified that no new laws have been introduced regarding the use of beach seine nets, stressing that authorities are only enforcing existing regulations.

title: Parliament approves motion to extend emergency
byline: The motion to extend the state of emergency by another month was approved by Parliament by a majority of 104 votes, with 106 MPs voting in favour and two against.

title: India reaffirms support for Sri Lanka at JVP–Jaishankar meeting
byline: A meeting was held in New Delhi between Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) General Secretary Tilvin Silva, who led a delegation from Sri Lanka, and India’s Minister of External Affairs S. Jaishankar.

title: T20 World Cup 2026 opener at SSC free for public
byline: The inaugural match of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, scheduled to be played tomorrow at the SSC Grounds in Colombo, will be open to the public free of charge.

title: Inivos COO Ayomi Gunawardana wins national export entrepreneur award
byline: Ayomi Gunawardana, Chief Operating Officer and Co-Founder of Inivos Consulting Pvt Ltd, has won two honours at the WCIC Prathibaabisheka Awards 2025.

title: 14-year-old Sooryavanshi rewrites history with 175 in U19 World Cup Final
byline: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi produced a sensational 175 off just 80 balls to power India to a historic 411/9 against England in the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 final in Harare, rewriting multiple tournament records in a stunning display of power hitting.

title: Chamithri Rambukwella released on bail
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate ordered that Chamithri Rambukwella, the elder daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, who was arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, be released on bail.

title: Suicide bombing at Islamabad Shiite mosque kills at least 30 people
byline: A suicide attack at a mosque in Pakistan’s capital city Islamabad killed at least 30 people and wounded more than 130 on Friday, a police source told AFP.

title: T20 World Cup 2026 Begins with Spectacular Mumbai Showcase
byline: The ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 will burst into life on Saturday evening with a high-energy Opening Ceremony at Mumbai’s iconic Wankhede Stadium, setting the tone for an action-packed tournament before co-hosts India face the USA.

title: Politics leave Pakistan no room for error at T20 World Cup
byline: Captain Salman Agha warned Friday that his Pakistan team must bring their ’’A-game’’ to the T20 World Cup to reach the knockout stages after forfeiting their group match against India.

title: Tuition classes banned ahead of 2025 (2026) G.C.E. O/L Examination
byline: Conducting tuition classes targeting candidates sitting for the 2025 (2026) G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination will be prohibited from midnight on February 11, the Department of Examinations announced.

title: 19 female conductors appointed to SLTB
byline: In a historic milestone for Sri Lanka’s public transport sector, 19 female conductors were appointed to permanent service in the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) at an official ceremony held this morning (06) at the Makumbura Multimodal Transport Center.

title: Deputy Minister clashes with Opposition MP in Parliament
byline: Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinge engaged in a heated argument with Opposition MP Chaminda Wijesiri in Parliament today while accusing each other of allegations.

title: Madras High Court adjourns hearing on plea to remove LTTE ban
byline: The Madras High Court has adjourned the hearing on a long-standing petition seeking the removal of the ban on the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) in India. The case was postponed until February 16, 2026, after the Union Government’s counsel requested more time during proceedings before a Division Bench.

title: Russian general shot several times in Moscow
byline: A high-profile general in Russia’s military has been shot several times and wounded in Moscow.

title: At least 18 die in ’rat-hole’ mine blast in India
byline: At least 18 miners have died and one is severely injured after an explosion at an illegally-operated coal mine in India’s northeastern state of Meghalaya, police say.

title: Chamithri Rambukwella arrested in money laundering case
byline: Chamithri Rambukwella, the elder daughter of former minister Keheliya Rambukwella, was arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with a money laundering allegation involving Rs. 300 million.

title: Sri Lanka to demand compensation for damages, theft of assets during colonial period: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka intends asking for compensation for damages of properties, thefts and loss of lives that had taken place during the colonial period, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath told Parliament today.

title: LAUGFS Gas raises domestic LPG prices for February 2026
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has announced an increase in domestic LPG refill prices for February 2026, effective from midnight today.

title: Record 175 from Suryavanshi Seals Sixth U19 Crown for India
byline: Teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi produced a breathtaking 175 off just 80 balls as India stormed to a record sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title with a commanding 100-run victory over England in the final.

title: President’s helicopter rides a source of sarcasm for opposition in Parliament
byline: In a sarcastic tone, the Opposition in Parliament yesterday welcomed President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s decision to travel to Kandy by helicopter, a move seen as a contrast to his past rhetoric.

title: GMOA warns of escalated TU over unresolved issues
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has warned that it is ready to further intensify its ongoing trade union action to protect Sri Lanka’s free public healthcare and hospital system, citing unresolved professional and administrative concerns.
